Course Description: EQUITY ACCOUNTING FOR PARTNERSHIPS; ACCOUNTING FOR BUSINESS EXPANSION; BRANCH ACCOUNTING; MERGERS AND CONSOLIDATIONS; CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS; AND FIDUCIARY, FUND, AND SOCIAL ACCOUNTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:

1.APPLY AND DESCRIBE THE ACCOUNTING ISSUES APPLICABLE TO THE LIQUIDATION OF A PARTNERSHIP, BOTH SINGLE-STEP AND INSTALLMENT
2.EXPLAIN THE NATURE OF BUSINESS COMBINATIONS AND GAAP FOR PURCHASE AND POOLING
3.EXPLAIN AND DISCUSS THE NATURE OF CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, HOW THEY ARE PREPARED AND CONSOLIDATION POLICY.  ILLUSTRATE JOURNAL ENTRIES, WORKING PAPERS AND ELIMINATION ENTRIES FOR THE PARENT AND SUBSIDIARIES
4.EXPLAIN AND DIFFERENTIATE THE EQUITY AND THE COST METHODS AND THE CONSEQUENT JOURNAL ENTRIES, DESCRIBE PURCHASE-TYPE JOURNAL ENTRIES, WORKING PAPERS AND ELIMINATIONS
5.BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THE BASICS OF GOVERNMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL ACCOUNTING, INCLUDING NON-PROFITS
6.UNDERSTAND SPECIFIC PROBLEMS IN BANKRUPTCY, ESTATES AND TRUSTS, AND INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
